[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Cinema Ticketing and Screening Management System (CTSMS) defines requirements for managing film screenings, seat reservations, and ticket sales.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: CTSMS automates film scheduling, ticket reservations, and seating management across cinema locations.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: CTSMS integrates with ticketing, payment, and scheduling systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: CTSMS provides dashboards for administrators and an online portal for customers.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: CTSMS supports barcode scanners, kiosks, and digital displays.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: CTSMS uses PostgreSQL, MongoDB, and REST APIs for booking and scheduling.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: CTSMS ensures secure transactions via TLS encryption and access control.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: CTSMS optimizes performance for real-time transactions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: CTSMS manages showtimes, reservations, payments, and seating.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: CTSMS adapts to different cinema layouts and seating policies.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: CTSMS connects with distributor databases, promotions, and loyalty programs.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: CTSMS enables movie scheduling, reservations, ticket sales, and reporting.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: CTSMS is designed for theater admins, booking agents, and customers.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: CTSMS requires internet connectivity for real-time availability and online bookings.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: CTSMS depends on accurate film schedules, available seating, and secure payments.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Seat Allocation: Process of reserving seats.
Box Office: Physical ticket sales location.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with cinema management software to manage schedules (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall track seat reservations and ticket sales (REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall process online and in-person payments securely (REQ-DB-003).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall handle ticket bookings, cancellations, and seat selection (REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall generate sales and booking reports (REQ-DB-003).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a web and mobile interface for customers and an admin dashboard.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process ticket transactions within 2 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store movie schedules and auditorium details.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall track ticket reservations and seat availability.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-003: The system shall maintain transaction and refund records.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall ensure unique IDs for screenings, tickets, and users.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with cinema regulations and payment security standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log booking modifications and transactions.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests scheduling, ticket processing, seat selection, and refunds.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API documentation, troubleshooting guides, and compliance policies.
[SEC] 5. References: Cinema industry standards, payment security policies, and customer data protection regulations.
